text:
Ro: Hey guys, it’s Ro! Welcome to another
Nerdy Nummies!

Ro: Today I have a very special guest, Mamrie!
Mamrie: Hello!

Ro: She has an awesome channel, I’ll put
links down below so you

Ro: can go check it out. And, this is a fun
fact, we’re both authors!

Ro: Well she’s an author first, now I’m
joining the club.

Mamrie: Welcome! Ro: She’s got this really
cool book, I’ll put links down

Ro: below so you can go check it out too.
It’s so cool!

Ro: I got so many requests from you guys to
make something Harry Potter themed.
Ro: And, she knows how to make a good drink.
Mamrie: I know my way around a bar.

Ro: That’s right! So today we are gonna
make a themed Harry Potter potion drink.

Ro: We are gonna be making something that
will hopefully give us some good luck.

Ro: We are gonna be making Felix Felicis,
which is liquid luck.

Mamrie: Love it! Ro: Yeah! Ro: Are you ready?
Mamrie: Yes!
Both: Let’s get started!

Ro: Alright, before we get started, Mamrie,
I got you this little

Ro: Gryffindor scarf. Mamrie: That is so thoughtful!
Ro: To get in the mood!

Mamrie: What a perfect gift for August in
Los Angeles!

Ro: We’re gonna be making 2 different versions
of this drink.

Ro: The first will be a spirited version,
and the second will be a non-alcoholic,
Ro: so, you can take your pick.

Ro: The things you will need, for the non-alcoholic
version will be:

Ro: Lemonade, you can use whatever you’d
like, white grape juice,

Ro: a juicer and we’ll both be using fresh
lemons, and some golden sanding sugar.

Mamrie: And for the more spirited version,
you’re gonna need a bunch of ice,

Mamrie: Simple Syrup, Triple Sec, Vodka, and
then a jigger and a shaker!
Ro: Nee-nee-nee! Now let’s put it all together!

Ro: The first thing that we’re gonna do
is juice some lemons, so you’re gonna

Ro: take a fresh little lemon over here. Mamrie:
Cool.

Ro: We’ve got our cutting boards, sharp
knives, don’t cut off your fingers,

Ro: be careful. Mamrie: Good to know. Ro:
Cut ‘em in half.

Ro: Oh we only have one juicer. Mamrie: I
guess we’ll have to learn how to share!

Ro: OK, rock, paper, scissors, who goes first?
Mamrie: OK.

Both: Rock, paper, scissors, shoot! Mamrie:
Mmmmmm!

Ro: I go first! Oh my gosh this is so exciting!
I never win challenges!

Mamrie: You can juice them all if you want
to, I’ll supervise!
Ro: Wait a minute, then am I really the winner?

Mamrie: OK, so now that our lemons are juiced.
Ro: Mmmhmmm.

Mamrie: We are going to rim our glasses in
the gold sanding sugar?

Mamrie: Did I get that right? Ro: Mmmhmm,
that’s right!

Mamrie: So, what we do is we take some of
our simple syrup, and this will kind

Mamrie: of act as the glue, so that the sanding
sugar can stick. Ro: So cool!

Mamrie: So, two easy steps, we get it a little
wet, and then, into the sanding sugar!

Ro: Whoa! That’s so pretty! Mamrie: Gorgeous!
Ro: I love it!

Ro: And you’re gonna do this to all of your
glasses.

Ro: Now that our glasses look all fancy, we
are going to be making the non-alcoholic

Ro: version first. So you’re gonna take
your lemonade and you’re gonna need

Ro: 2 ounces of lemonade for each drink, then
we will need one ounce per drink
Ro: of the grape juice.

Mamrie: Last but not least we have our fresh
lemon juice, and you’re gonna need

Mamrie: a half ounce per drink, so I’m gonna
put in an ounce for the two.

Mamrie: Did you ever do a lemonade stand?
Ro: My sister and I had one really

Ro: briefly, and then we upgraded to a car
wash.
Mamrie: Entrepreneur!

Mamrie: Last, I’m gonna add a couple ice
cubes to the shaker.

Mamrie: This will make it nice and cold, so
then you can have a cold drink without
Mamrie: having ice. Ro: I love it.

Mamrie: Because sometimes I like a
cold drink and I don’t like the ice

Mamrie: to hit my teeth. Ro: Mmmhmmm, mmmhmm.
Mamrie: I got sensitive teeth!

Mamrie: Shake it up. Ro: Yeah. Mamrie: You
want to do the honors?

Ro: No let me watch you do it first, I’ll
do the second one.
Mamrie: Get ready! Ro: OK.
Ro: This is fun! Mamrie: Yeah! Ro: I’m practicing.

Mamrie: We do this instead of aerobics! Ro:
I like that.

Mamrie: Just gotta pour it in without it hitting
our beautiful dust.
Mamrie: Boom! Look at that! Ro: That is beautiful!
Ro: Oh! Cheers to good luck! Mamrie: Cheers!

Ro: Mmmmmmm! Mamrie: Oh that’s so good!
Ro: I like that lemon.

Mamrie: I love it with the grape juice! So
it’s not too, too, too tart!

Mamrie: So you don’t walk around with this
crazy face!
Mamrie: Mmmhmm. That’s good!

Ro: That looks like another character from
Harry Potter, guess who in the comments

Ro: below. Mamrie: I don’t know… I didn’t,
I didn’t read it.

Ro: If you put it on like this… Mamrie:
Mmmhmm! Ro: Do I look like Kesha?
Mamrie: I want some of that action!

Ro: Do we look like Kesha? Mamrie: Do we look
like models?

Ro: Our first drink was super yummy and now
we are onto our second drink, the

Ro: more spirited version! Mamrie: Mmmhmm,
it’s essentially a lemon drop,

Mamrie: because we wanted it to have that
light yellow color, like the potion
Mamrie: does in the movie. Ro: Mmmhmm!

Mamrie: The first thing that we’re gonna
use is the vodka, and it’s 1-1/2

Mamrie: ounce per drink, so since we’re
making two drinks, we’ll put in 3 ounces.

Ro: I love learning this, so what are we gonna
do next?

Ro: What’s the next ingredient. Mamrie:
What a fun way to put me to work!

Mamrie: We’re gonna add a half a ounce of
triple sec to each drink, so one ounce
Mamrie: for the two. Ro: OK.

Mamrie: That made like a comedic glug-glug-glug
noise!
Ro: Glug-glug-glug-glug-glug-glug-glug-glug!

Mamrie: And then the other two ingredients
are also a half ounce each.

Ro: Oh, can I shake it this time? Mamrie:
Please! I’m exhausted!
Ro: Will you teach me your shake ways? Mamrie: Yeah! Ro: OK!

Mamrie: Here… Is the real deal. Ro: Alright,
so how do you?

Mamrie: Put your hand on top so it doesn’t
spew everywhere.

Mamrie: And then you kind of do like, a-shake-it-up,
a-shake-it-down!

Mamrie: Shake-it-up, a-shake-it-down! Shake-it-up,
a-shake-it-down!
Ro: Shake it? Mamrie: Yeah!

Both: Shake-it-up, a-shake-it-down! Shake-it-up,
a-shake-it-down! Shake it!
Mamrie: Uh-huh! Yeah! Faster now! Faster now!

Ro: How fast do you go? Mamrie: As fast as
you want.

Mamrie: So right in the middle, not too fast.
Ro: Be really careful, right? OK.
Ro: Oh, uh!

Mamrie: This is lucky huh? Ro: Yeah! This
one’s gonna be very lucky, because

Ro: it’s got a little spirit in her. Are
you ready for good luck?
Mamrie: I’m ready let’s go to vegas!
Ro: Mmmmm! Mamrie: Yes ma’am! Yes, ma’am!
Ro: Simple, delicious, good luck, right on!
Both: Ta-da!

Ro: Here are the Harry Potter themed drinks
that we made today, our little

Ro: Felix Felicis! Over here we have the non-alcoholic,
and over here,

Ro: the more spirited! Mamrie: Spirit fingers!
Ro: Spirit, yes!

Ro: Thanks you guys for suggesting something
Harry Potter themed,

Ro: these are super yummy and I had so much
fun making these, and a big thank you to

Ro: Mamrie! Thank you for coming! Mamrie:
Thank you for having me this was a blast!

Ro: She’s amazing, again I’ll be putting
all her links down below, so go check her

Ro: out, and if you guys have any other ideas
for any other Nerdy Nummies,

Ro: please let me know, leave me a comment
down below and I will do my best

Ro: to make it happen, and, we will be posting
pictures of these cute little drinks

Ro: on Facebook, Tumblr, Twitter and Instagram,
and if you guys make these,

Ro: please take a picture and send it to us,
you can tweet either of us.

Mamrie: I’d love it! Ro: Tweet your pictures
to us, we love to retweet and I

Ro: love to favorite ‘em, because it just
makes my day!
Ro: Alright, thanks again you guys, bye-bye!
Mamrie: Cheers! Ro: Yes!
Ro: Mmmmmm! Mamrie: I feel lucky!
